alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Typhoon Warning issued May 25 at 7:38AM ChST until further notice by NWS Guam
info.description: .NEW INFORMATION... Tropical Storm Warning and Typhoon Watch have been cancelled for Tinian and Saipan. .AREAS AFFECTED... This local statement provides important information and recommended actions for people in Guam and the Northern Marianas. .Watches/Warnings... A Typhoon Warning continues for Guam and Rota. Typhoon force winds of 74 mph are slowly subsiding. A Tropical Storm Warning and a Typhoon Watch has been cancelled for Saipan and Tinian. A Flood Watch remains in effect for Guam. Please listen closely for any Flood Warnings that might be in effect for your area. .STORM INFORMATION... At 4 AM ChST...the center of Typhoon Mawar (02W) was located near latitude 14.1N...longitude 144.1E. This was about 65 miles north- northwest of Guam and 75 miles west of Rota. Storm motion was northwest at 8 mph. Storm intensity was 140 mph. .SITUATION OVERVIEW... The center of Mawar has left the Marianas waters, but strong winds remain over the area on the scale of strong tropical storm force winds. Winds remain strong over the region with coastal areas still under threat from inundation. Significant coastal erosion is likely, particularly along western shorelines. Flood watch is still in effect. .PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... You should be in a fully-reinforced concrete structure, especially on Guam. Stay inside and away from windows. Do not venture outside when high winds are occurring or during temporary lulls as flying debris can easily, and suddenly, cause serious injury. Have a well-charged cell phone nearby, keeping network communications as open as possible for emergencies. Once conditions have improved, remain in shelter until the all-clear, COR 4, is announced from government officials. Closely monitor NOAA weather radio or other local news outlets for official storm information. Listen for the latest forecasts. ...TYPHOON WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT... ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT... ...New Information... Mawar is northwest of Guam and pulling away from the Marianas. Mawar`s current location puts the risk of highest surf along west and north facing reefs. ...PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Residents should remain in shelter within sturdy concrete homes with concrete roofs, or wherever you are. Again, once conditions have improved sometime late Thursday or Friday, remain in shelter until the all-clear, Cor 4, is given by government officials. && ...Winds... Typhoon force winds have eased to tropical storm conditions this morning. Tropical storm conditions may persist into the afternoon. Exposed, higher terrain of the island is likely to experience higher winds. The island can expect continued tropical storm winds shifting south-southwest to south to southeast today. When the all-clear is given and you leave shelters, use caution as there will be debris in the roads, power lines down, possible hazardous material scattered around the island. Wear protective clothing and footwear to help avoid injury. ...Storm surge and storm tide... West/North Coastal Areas: Storm surge has decreased and will continue to subside as Mawar continues to move away from Guam. Eastern Guam: Storm surge is no longer expected for southeastern Guam around Inalahan up to Pago/Mangilao. Dangerous surf persists along western and northern coastlines as a large north swell generated by Mawar affects these shorelines. ...Inland flooding... A Flood Watch remains in effect for Guam until late this morning. Showers are decreasing across the island. However, due to the amount of rainfall on the island, minor flash flooding remains a possibility. Listen for possible flood warnings, and be ready to act if flooding rains occur. Additional rainfall of 1 to 3 inches of rain is possible the next few hours as Mawar moves away. Monitor conditions for possible flood advisories or warnings.
